Detailed Description

The configuration defines are used to change default settings.

Configuration defines can transport values down to the source code to configure corresponding values (e.g. message queue size). All these defines used for configuration issues must have a default value, which is set in the source code in case the define is not set from outside.


Naming convention for new created configuration defines:

APOXI_CONFIG_<functionality>, where

  • <parameter> describes the parameter, which is customized.

Define Documentation

#define APOXI_ALARMMANAGER_MAX_ENTRIES
 

Maximum number of different ExecutionContext's (Applications) which accesses AlarmManger

AlarmManager has to store data for each registered ExecutionContext. The amount of possible registrations is limited by this define. Default value is 10.

#define APOXI_ARAGON_MAX_BUFFER_SIZE
 

Describes the buffer size for the communication with the ARAGON Tool.

Describes the buffer size for the communication with the ARAGON Tool. Per default a value of 200000 is used.

#define APOXI_CACHED_POLYGON_EDGES_MAX
 

Defines the maximum numbers of edges a polygon may have on the stack.

Defines the maximum numbers of edges a polygon may have on the stack. If nothing is set, a default value of 10 is used.


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_ENABLE_POLYGON_DRAWING


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_DC_POLYGON_MAX_EDGES_ON_STACK
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_CBS_DEFAULT_ACTIVE_TIMER
 

Default value of the active timer value for the CBS subsystem

For certain projects this timer value can be changed by default, unit are seconds. Default values are for all OSes is 0.

#define APOXI_CBS_DEFAULT_SLEEP_TIMER
 

Default value of the sleep timer value for the CBS subsystem

For certain projects this timer value can be changed by default, unit are seconds. Default values are for all OSes is 0.

#define APOXI_CONFIG_DBG_OUT_RANGE_ARRAY
 

Defines the amount of possible DBG_OUT Id Ranges on target.

On host simulation DBG_OUT messages are filtered using file DbgOutRange.txt in APOXI_TEMP folder. Multiple ranges can be defined. On target there is the possibility to filter DBG_OUT messages during runtime using AT command
at+xapoxi="dbgout range_idx id_from id_to"
The possible values for parameter range_idx is 0..APOXI_CONFIG_DBG_OUT_RANGE_ARRAY-1, default value for APOXI_CONFIG_DBG_OUT_RANGE_ARRAY is 5

See also:
RuntimeConfigurator

Define dependencies:
  • APOXI_ENABLE_RUNTIME_CONFIGURATION

#define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_CONTEXT_TRACE_MAX_CTX
 

Number of maximum contexts which can be traced if APOXI_HEAP_MEM_CONTEXT_TRACE is set

This define allows changing the default number of apps/threads which can be traced if the define APOXI_HEAP_MEM_CONTEXT_TRACE is set, Default value is 50 .

#define APOXI_MAX_DISPLAY_COUNT
 

Defines the maximum number of displays APOXI can handle at the same time.

Defines the maximum number of displays APOXI can handle at the same time. Per default the maximum number is set to 2.

#define APOXI_MAX_LANGUAGE_COUNT
 

Defines the maximum number of languages APOXI can handle at the same time.

Defines the maximum number of languages APOXI can handle at the same time. Per default the maximum number is set to 16.

#define APOXI_MAX_SOFTKEY_COUNT
 

Defines the maximum number of softkeys.

Defines the maximum number of softkeys. Per default the maximum number is set to 2.

#define APOXI_MSG_QUEUE_KEY_ENTRY_LIMIT
 

Limitation for queued key entries

The define is used to configure the limitation for key entries in the focus message queue. If the limit is reached in the message queue, all additional events coming from the keyboard driver are no longer queued (discarded). If the define is not set, then there is no limitation (default behavior).

Applicable range for APOXI_MSG_QUEUE_KEY_ENTRY_LIMIT is 1..n.

#define APOXI_MSG_QUEUE_YIELD_COUNTER
 

Counter for Yield calls in MsgQueue

If this define is set to any value (1..n) the message queue is calling Thread::Yield() after the defined amount of messages taken out of the queue. This enables the system to switch to another waiting thread with the same priority. If for example the define is set to 10, each AppContainer enables to switch to another AppContainer after every 10th handled message.

If APOXI_COMPAT_2_0_0 is not set, this define is obsolete and replaced by APOXI_MSG_QUEUE_YIELD_PERIOD.


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_0_0

#define APOXI_MSG_QUEUE_YIELD_PERIOD
 

Time period for Yield calls in MsgQueue

If an AppContainer is permanently busy with handling messages, after this period of time (in ms) it calls Thread::Yield(). This enables the system to switch to another waiting Thread with the same priority. The default value is 100 (ms).


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_COMPAT_2_0_0

#define APOXI_PHONENUMBER_MATCH_DEFAULT_DEPTH
 

Default number of digits which shall be used for matching method

This define allows changing the default number of digits which shall be used for the matching method used inside the PhoneNumber class. Default value is 6 which means that the last 6 digits are used, if they are equal then the phonenumber matches.

#define APOXI_POLYGON_EDGES_MAX
 

Defines the maximum numbers of edges a polygon may have.

Defines the maximum numbers of edges a polygon may have. If nothing is set, a default value of 50 is used.


Corresponding features:

  • MULTIMEDIA


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_ENABLE_POLYGON_DRAWING


Enabled backward compatibility:

  • obsoleted define: APOXI_DC_POLYGON_MAX_EDGES
  • obsoleted define cleared out: APOXI_3.0.0

#define APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_LOWER_BOUND
 

Defines timer impreciseness to optimize power consumption.

Impreciseness for APOXI timers can be configured by setting this define. For example if set to 10, a timer with timeout value 1000 ms is allowed to expire earliest after 990 ms. This makes it possible for hardware drivers to align the processor wake up and reduce power consumption.


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_UPPER_BOUND
  • APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_RANGE

#define APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_RANGE
 

Defines timer impreciseness to optimize power consumption.

Impreciseness for APOXI timers can be configured by setting this define. For example if set to 20, a timer with timeout value 1000 ms is allowed to expire earliest after 990 ms and latest after 1010 ms. This makes it possible for hardware drivers to align the processor wake up and reduce power consumption.
If APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_RANGE is set, additional settings for APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_LOWER_BOUND and APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_UPPER_BOUND are getting obsolete.


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_LOWER_BOUND
  • APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_UPPER_BOUND

#define APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_UPPER_BOUND
 

Defines timer impreciseness to optimize power consumption.

Impreciseness for APOXI timers can be configured by setting this define. For example if set to 10, a timer with timeout value 1000 ms is allowed to expire latest after 1010 ms. This makes it possible for hardware drivers to align the processor wake up and reduce power consumption.


Define dependencies:

  • APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_LOWER_BOUND
  • APOXI_POWERSAVING_TIMER_ALIGNMENT_RANGE

#define APOXI_SHUTDOWN_APP_CLOSE_TIMEOUT
 

Timeout for closing applications during shut-down.

If shutting down takes too long, APOXI will power off the phone without waiting any longer for applications to close. The default value is 20 (seconds).

#define APOXI_SHUTDOWN_CHECK_APPLICATIONS_INTERVAL
 

Interval for shutdown device for checking applications.

During the shutdown process APOXI is periodically checking if all applications are closing and AppContainers are terminating correctly. This define is to configure the interval for this checks. The default value is 500 (ms).

#define APOXI_SMSSOCKET_MAX_CACHED_TPDUS
 

Defines the maximum number of Tpdus which shall be cached by a SmsSocket Defines the maximum number of Tpdus which shall be cached by a SmsSocket for an application, which has been registered. The default value is set to 12.

#define APOXI_SMSSOCKET_MAX_SUBSCRIBED_APPS
 

Defines the maximum number of applications which can register for a SmsSocket Defines the maximum number of applications which can register for a SmsSocket which then shall be notified in case a PushSms arrives. The default value is set to 2.

#define APOXI_THREAD_PRIORITY_NORMAL
 

Default priority level for APOXI tasks

APOXI provides predefined priority levels for task configuration. PriorityNormal is set to a OS dependent value, which can be changed. Default values are:

  • WIN32: THREAD_PRIORITY_NORMAL (see VC++ documentation)
  • OSE166: 20
  • NUC32: 100

See also:
Thread::PriorityLevel
